verses.roman:
namas te vāsudevāya
sarva-bhūta-kṣayāya ca
hṛṣīkeśa namas tubhyaṁ
prapannaṁ pāhi māṁ prabho

synonyms: namaḥ—obeisances; te—to You; vāsudevāya—the son of Vasudeva; sarva—of all; bhūta—living beings; kṣayāya—the residence; ca—and; hṛṣīka-īśa—O Lord of the mind and senses; namaḥ—obeisances; tubhyam—to You; prapannam—who am surrendered; pāhi—please protect; mām—me; prabho—O master.
translation: O son of Vasudeva, obeisances to You, within whom all living beings reside. O Lord of the mind and senses, again I offer You my obeisances. O master, please protect me, who am surrendered unto You.
